page.title: 06FARMING 40 YEARS AGO
page.content: Very{small holdings}were occupied by poor people.3/4 of the homesteads have been sold with 1-8 acres to fairly wealthy commuters who nothing of farming.On a line in a N.E.direction from mid-West there were {10 milking {farms}Only one remains which now produces 50% more milk than the 10 together from 1/2 the cows and1/3 land This has been done by{fertilizers, {better breedingand improved seed}Much moorland has been converted from moor- land to grassland by draining and reseeding.{Prices 40 years ago Land } Â£5-20.{Property,}Â£50-150,{Cow}Â£20,{ {Calf Â£4. Today}Â£1000-1600, Â£30-70,000 Â£600,Â£80.Near{Hubberton}there has been little change in the pattern of farming.Most farmers are content to carry on as they have always done {
